definition: to argue noisily/to shout/to make widely known/to reproach

sentences.english: They rushed clamorously into the presence of the lioness, and demanded of her the settlement of the dispute.
sentences.chinese: 他們吵吵嚷嚷，跑到母獅面前，請她解決爭端。

sentences.english: Audrey hung her head when I shouted at her.
sentences.chinese: 我對奧德麗嚷嚷時她低下了頭。

sentences.english: The noisy fellow was thrown out of the hall.
sentences.chinese: 這個吵吵嚷嚷的傢伙被人從大廳裏攆出去了。

sentences.english: You know how I hate people who bawl all the time.
sentences.chinese: 你知道我就看不慣那種成天嚷嚷嚷的人。

sentences.english: Then they would make a clamor, or throw in a burning plastic bag.
sentences.chinese: 然後他們會大聲嚷嚷，或者扔一個點着的塑料袋進去。

sentences.english: A bitter controversy about the siting of the airport is rumbling in the designing institute.
sentences.chinese: 設計院裏正吵吵嚷嚷着對機場選址問題作激烈爭論。

sentences.english: The needle shouted at the fingers.
sentences.chinese: 針衝着捏着她的手指嚷嚷。

sentences.english: People did get stressed. Some shouted at each other.
sentences.chinese: 人們真的感到壓力很大，有些人大聲嚷嚷。

sentences.english: The mother shouted told me to hold off small lots.
sentences.chinese: 母親嚷嚷着叫我把小多多抱下車。

sentences.english: A few shouts came from the water where some officers were having a water fight in the shallow surf.
sentences.chinese: 幾個軍官在淺水裏打水仗，傳來了幾聲嚷嚷聲。

sentences.english: That is why most of us laugh when some American says BUY AMERICAN product.
sentences.chinese: 這就是爲什麼我們笑那些嚷嚷着“買美國貨”的人。

sentences.english: 'Did you hear that, Workhouse?' shouted Noah.
sentences.chinese: “你聽見了嗎，濟貧院？”諾厄嚷嚷道。

sentences.english: The other coaches would be screaming at their girls, humiliating them, shouting at them.
sentences.chinese: 對方教練對自己的球員尖叫着，斥罵她們，大聲嚷嚷。

sentences.english: Tom stood up to speak , but people clamoured him down.
sentences.chinese: 湯姆站起來講話，但人們嚷嚷着把他轟了下去。

sentences.english: There was also a vociferous tunnel party.
sentences.chinese: 當然，也有一些人嚷嚷着要修建跨海隧道。

sentences.english: I'm sorry I yelled at you people.
sentences.chinese: 我對你們大聲嚷嚷，非常抱歉。

definition: to murmur/to speak in a low voice
to shout and quarrel/to make a big fuss
to cry out/to bark out a sound
to swear while talking/to be foul-mouthed
to berate/to excoriate/to chide/also written 喝斥[he1 chi4]
